phoenix

Class fanart

  • java.lang.Object
    • phoenix.fanart

  • public final class fanart
extends java.lang.Object
    API Generated: Tue May 17 06:47:42 EDT 2016
    API Source: FanartAPI
    Fanart is a STV api that encapsulates accessing Backgrounds, Banners, Posters, etc for SageTV media objects.

    see PhoenixFanartSupport for more specific information about where it will look for fanart for the new Central Folder Structure see LocalFanartSupport for more specific information about where the LocalFanartSupport will look for fanart see SageMCFanartSupport for more specific information about where it will look for fanart for SageMC

    The default support is for PhoenixFanartSupport but you can switch to using SageMC by setting the following property.

    Any developers wishing to use thier own Fanart Support system can careate an implemenation for IFanartSupport and register it using the phoenix/mediametadata/fanartSupportClass property 

     phoenix/mediametadata/fanartSupportClass=sagex.phoenix.fanart.SageMCFanartSupport

        public static java.lang.String GetFanartBackground(java.lang.Object mediaObject)
        Given a Sage Airing, Show, or MediaFile, get the background.

        The API will resolve whether or not Fanart is enabled and whether or not the Central Fanart directory is to be used.

        Parameters:
        mediaObject - - SageTV MediaFile, Airing, or Show object
        Returns:
        file location of the Background

      • SetFanartBackground

        public static void SetFanartBackground(java.lang.Object mediaObject,
                                       java.lang.Object fanart)
        Sets the Current Poster to use as the Default. Fanart directory must already exist, and the fanart parameter must exist as a file in the Fanart diretory.
        Parameters:
        mediaObject - media object on which the default fanart is being set
        fanart - File or String path that must exist, and it must be a file in the Fanart directory for that given mediafile.

      • GetFanartArtifacts

        public static java.lang.String[] GetFanartArtifacts(java.lang.Object mediaObject,
                                                    java.lang.String mediaType,
                                                    java.lang.String mediaTitle,
                                                    java.lang.String artifactType,
                                                    java.lang.String artifactTitle,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        This method parallels the GetFanartArtifac() call, except this method will return ALL fanart the given set of parameters.
        Parameters:
        mediaObject - Sage MediaFile/Airing object (can be null, if you are asking for Genres or Actors)
        mediaType - one of tv, movie, music, actor, genre
        mediaTitle - media tile (or genre title if mediaType is genre, or actor name if mediaType is actor)
        artifactType - one of poster, background, banner
        artifactTitle - this is normally always null, but if it's not, then it will basically become a child sub directory in the fanart path
        metadata - any extra metadata, such as SeasonNumber if you doing season specific fanart
        Returns:

      • GetFanartArtifact

        public static java.lang.String GetFanartArtifact(java.lang.Object mediaObject,
                                                 java.lang.String mediaType,
                                                 java.lang.String mediaTitle,
                                                 java.lang.String artifactType,
                                                 java.lang.String artifactTitle,
                                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Generic Fanart API Call for fetching fanart. Basically each parameter, when not null, will join to form the complete fanart path. For example, if you called,

         GetFanartArtifact(MediaFile, "tv", "House", "poster", null, null)


        then it would basically resolve to a fanart folder path of

         FANARTDIR/TV/House/Posters/


        If you pass mediaType and mediaTitle as null, but mediaObject is not null, then mediaType and mediaTitle will be automatically fetched from the mediaObject.

        If you want to do season specific fanart (only valid for TV), then pass a Map as the metadata with a key of SeasonNumber and a value for SeasonNumber. If passed, then season specific fanart will be resolved. If No season specific fanart is available, then standard fanart will be available.

        the mediaObject can be any of File, Sage MediaFile, Sage Airing, MediaFile ID, or an IMediaFile object

        Parameters:
        mediaObject - Sage MediaFile/Airing object (can be null, if you are asking for Genres or Actors)
        mediaType - one of tv, movie, music, actor, genre
        mediaTitle - media tile (or genre title if mediaType is genre, or actor name if mediaType is actor)
        artifactType - one of poster, background, banner
        artifactTitle - this is normally always null, but if it's not, then it will basically become a child sub directory in the fanart path
        metadata - any extra metadata, such as SeasonNumber if you doing season specific fanart
        Returns:

      • GetFanartArtifactDir

        public static java.lang.String GetFanartArtifactDir(java.lang.Object mediaObject,
                                                    java.lang.String mediaType,
                                                    java.lang.String mediaTitle,
                                                    java.lang.String artifactType,
                                                    java.lang.String artifactTitle,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata,
                                                    boolean create)
        Much like the GetFanartArtifact() call, except this only return the directory. If create == true, then the directory structure will be created, if it does not exist. Null is returned if the folder does not exist and cannot be created.
        Parameters:
        mediaObject -
        mediaType -
        mediaTitle -
        artifactType -
        artifactTitle -
        metadata -
        create - Create the folder if it does not exist
        Returns:

      • GetFanartArtifactDir

        public static java.lang.String GetFanartArtifactDir(java.lang.Object mediaObject,
                                                    MediaType mediaType,
                                                    java.lang.String mediaTitle,
                                                    MediaArtifactType artifactType,
                                                    java.lang.String artifactTitle,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata,
                                                    boolean create)

      • GetDefaultEpisode

        public static java.lang.Object GetDefaultEpisode(java.lang.Object mediaObject)
        Gets the Episode Fanart image for a given media file, or if the Episode is null, then it will return the default thumbnail.
        Parameters:
        mediaObject - Sage MediaFile
        Returns:
        Path to Episode Fanart or the series image if the episode image is null

      • ClearMemoryCaches

        public static void ClearMemoryCaches()
        Clears the in memory cache of images. Caching in memory is fairly short term, but if you need to to flush the memory to pick up changed, then you can use this API.

        This method is called automatically when setFanartArifact is used, otherwise, the poster, background, banner, etc, would not be seen for several minutes.

      • ImageKey

        public static java.lang.String ImageKey(java.lang.Object mediaObject,
                                        MediaType mediaType,
